tool.name: ErwinATyper Erwinia amylovora genomic analysis
tool.description: Analyze Erwinia genomes for various genetic elements
tool.command: python '$__tool_directory__/biofago_runner.py' --input '$input' --threshold_species '$threshold_species' $keep_sequence_loci --log_level '$log_level' --output_dir . && mv species_finder/all_results.csv '$output_csv' && echo "Current directory contents:" 1>&2 && ls -R . 1>&2 #if $keep_sequence_loci: && echo "Attempting to create zip file..." 1>&2 && python '$__tool_directory__/create_zip.py' 'types_finder' '$sequence_archive' && echo "Zip creation attempt finished" 1>&2 && echo "Created zip file: $sequence_archive" 1>&2 && ls -l '$sequence_archive' 1>&2 #end if

param.name: keep_sequence_loci
param.label: Create downloadable sequence archive
param.help: If checked, a zip file containing sequence loci will be created for download

tool.help:
This tool analyzes Erwinia genomes for various genetic elements including plasmids, CRISPR systems, and antibiotic resistance genes.
**Inputs**
* A genome file in FASTA format * ANI threshold for species assignment * Option to keep sequence loci * Logging level
**Outputs**
* A CSV file containing analysis results for the input genome * **Sequence Archive**: When "Keep sequence loci" is selected, a zip archive containing the sequences will be available for download. This archive preserves the folder structure and can be downloaded for further analysis outside Galaxy.
The sequence archive includes the following structure::
types_finder/ [Genome Name]/ types_capsule/ # Capsule biosynthesis locus types_cellulose/ # Cellulose biosynthesis locus types_lps/ # Lipopolysaccharide biosynthesis locus types_srl/ # Sorbitol metabolism locus types_T3SS_I/ # Type III Secretion System I types_T3SS_II/ # Type III Secretion System II types_flag3/ # Flagellar system 3 types_flag_I/ # Flagellar system I types_flag_II/ # Flagellar system II types_flag_III/ # Flagellar system III types_flag_IV/ # Flagellar system IV PROKKA_[DATE].fna # Nucleotide sequences PROKKA_[DATE].gbk # GenBank format annotations
Each type directory contains: * .fna files: Nucleotide sequences in FASTA format * .gbk files: Complete annotations in GenBank format
**Note**: If the sequence archive creation fails, the tool will continue to run and provide the CSV output. Check the tool's log for any warnings or errors related to the archive creation.
